result.execSummary:
The defendant Krissa A. BRASURE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC possess cocaine (2nd+) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Perform 30 hours of community service work

Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.  
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 05-21-15 at 3:30 p.m.  Plea date is set for 08-06-15 at 9:00 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Preliminary hearing on 03-31-15 at 1:30 p.m.  
Copy filed.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-31-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for her initial appearance on 03-23-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Copy filed.
RE:  PTC possess cocaine-2nd or subsequent offense, on 03-03-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess cocaine.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-23-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that she maintain absolute sobriety. Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
